newsitem.title: USA: Mycogen in alliance with Europe's Verneuil.
newsitem.headline: Mycogen in alliance with Europe's Verneuil.

text.p: Mycogen Corp said it had signed letters of intent for transactions through which it will form a strategic alliance with Verneuil Holding, a major European seed company based in France.

The company said the agreements call for it to exchange its existing European seed business and other assets for an 18.75 percent interest in Verneuil Holding and for Mycogen to obtain an option for it to purchase another 16.25 percent of Verneuil currently owned by DowElanco.
DowElanco, a partnership of Dow Chemical Co and Eli Lilly & Co, is Mycogen's largest stockholder, with approximately 48 percent of the company's common shares.

Verneuil Holding makes hybrid seed corn, sunflower, wheat, barley and other seed products in several European countries and North Africa. Verneuil had 1996 revenues of approximately $62 million, Mycogen said in a statement.

Mycogen, which ranks its Mycogen Seeds subsidiary as the sixth largest seed company in the United States, said its European seed revenues were $8 million. The seed unit has been a leader in developing insect-resistant corn hybrids.
In September, Mycogen acquired Morgan Seeds, Argentina's third largest seed company.

"Europe is the world's second largest agricultural market, and this alliance will greatly strengthen our position there," said Jerry Caulder, Mycogen's chairman and chief executive officer. "Our technology will help Verneuil to develop new, value-added products, and an exchange of breeding material between the companies will be mutually beneficial."
